alert.note: Alert for Baker; Inland Nassau; Western Clay; Western Duval (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 4:05PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN NASSAU...CENTRAL BAKER...NORTHWESTERN CLAY...WEST CENTRAL DUVAL AND SOUTH CENTRAL CHARLTON COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM EDT... At 404 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms 7 miles south of St. George, or 16 miles southwest of Callahan, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts around 40 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Taylor, Macclenny, Glen St. Mary, Maxville, Bryceville, and Baldwin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Baker; Inland Nassau; Western Clay; Western Duval
